Technique: BURNED, OXIDIZED; ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Cylix
Description: Bitruncate cone-shaped cylix, with a curvature set off by a groove, a wide mouth, a rounded rim and a stable base with ring-shaped foot. Paste of an ochre colour and surface covered with a reddish coating. The upper half of the body presents a painted decoration with a design of diagonal crosses in white, demarcated by lines in black which are now to a large extent lost.
